name: Asian Sesame Chicken Bowl
description: Tender chicken coated in a sesame sauce, served with brown rice and fresh vegetables. A perfectly balanced meal with Asian flavors.

instructions.instruction: Rinse the brown rice. Add to a pot with 2.5 cups of water, bring to boil, then simmer for 20-25 minutes.
Prepare the sauce: Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, honey, and cornstarch in a bowl.
Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Coat with 1 tablespoon of cornstarch.
instructions.tip: Cornstarch creates a thin, crispy coating.

instructions.instruction: Heat a large pan or wok over high heat. Add a thin layer of oil.
Cook the chicken pieces for 5-6 minutes until golden on all sides.
Add garlic and ginger, saut√© for 30 seconds.
Pour the sauce over the chicken, stir until sauce thickens.
Cook the edamame according to package directions.
Divide the rice into bowls. Arrange chicken, edamame, carrots, and cucumber on top.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onion. Serve hot.

tips: For low sodium, use reduced-sodium soy sauce.
Brown rice provides more fiber and minerals than white rice.
Can be stored in the fridge for 4 days - perfect for meal prep.
Add sriracha or chili flakes for a spicy kick.
storageInfo: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. Reheat with a splash of water.
servingSuggestion: Serve with pickled ginger or kimchi on the side. Great for post-workout meals.
variations: Can also be made with salmon.
Tofu makes a great vegan alternative.
